title: Cross-border payment processing
description: 国境を越えた決済は手間がかかる上に、サービス料が高いことで知られています。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has submitted the same proposal 5 times (3 times in the developer ecosystem, once in grow Africa and once in NFT business models). It is not clear how a cryptocurrency exchange is related to the developer ecosystem. The description of why this would be useful focusses on users not having access to local currency pairs.
f6_assessments.q1:
No real plan has been presented and a statement that "We have developed and tested a cryptocurrency and forex exchange" doesn't mean much without evidence. Each of the 5 proposals submitted has some small change in this experience. If they had done them all, why not add all of them to every proposal?

I would expect if an existing exchange wanted to add Cross-border payment processing they would just do so, why build a new exchange? What countries/currency pairs do you expect to add?

How are you going to market the project? Why do you think you can go from nothing to 10 million in cross border payments in 3 months?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has given deliverables, timelines and numbers of users and in that sense progress would be easy to audit. Though the numbers seem to be too high to be achievable (10 million in cross border payments in 3 months?).
f6_assessments.reply: Each proposal addresses different problems and solutions, however, they have some similarities but operate independently. The project is ready for production, so there is no feasibility issue. Project URL and teste users were available on the plan detail. The team has proven experience with a working product.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has submitted 5 similar projects, all with the same deficiencies, so some of the assessments are repeating. This project is about developing a cross-border payment solution. However, the proposed project is not part of the objective of this Challenge as it is an application instead of something specifically for the developer ecosystem. Furthermore, the proposer provides little information to evaluate the scope of the project.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has not provided any links or references to prove that the proposed solution is feasible (or that the linked projects really belong to them). The roadmap is inadequate in that they do not present an actionable plan. The budget is described but not explained. Overall, with the given information, no statement can be made about the feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The presented plan is completely untransparent. The metrics presented are not useful without the context of how they can come about. The shared information does not allow auditing the implementation.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is not about developer tools, so the category seems wrong. Generally speaking, it is hard to see what new the project would bring over existing centralised exchanges or on/off-ramps, which is what this proposal appears to be, also based on the mockup site provided and the proposers second proposal 'Cryptocurrency Exchange' that refers to the same site. It almost appears a duplicate of this proposal, so the proposers should be careful to distinguish the two proposals. Possibly some features in what is being proposed to be developed here would be more directed towards merchants, but in that case it would be good if the proposers described those features in detail.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer should indicate past projects and succesess to allow assessing their personal capability to succesfully execute the project. The provided success timeline appears unrealistic considering that a) there is no marketing, regularity compliance budget or plan, no fiat payment (partnership) budget or plan, only developer budget, and b) there are plenty of competing centralised exchanges. The proposers should concentrate more on these aspects if they believe that there is demand for their project.
f6_assessments.q2: The milestones provided are clear, but the processed transaction values appear highly unrealistic given that there are no partnership or marketing plans. The budget has enough detail.
f6_assessments.reply: The existing centralized exchange has no support for African currency. Projects are not duplicated they all work independently and solve different challenges. The team experience and past success are presented with a fully functioning product. Project URL was provided in the detailed plan also more details were available on the white paper.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal does not belong in this category. This is not something that is aimed at benefiting the developer ecosystem, but instead the end user.
f6_assessments.q1: No real experience is provided for the team, and there is only a vauge timeline with no plans of implementation for the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Considering the timeline is unclear and they have not provided enough supporting material and experience, the information we have at hand is not sufficient to audit progress and success.
f6_assessments.reply: The Ennarea financial service as a whole will highly impact the adoption of the Cardano ecosystem in every aspect. Cardano will most likely be a government blockchain, thousand of commodities  NFTs, Stabel coins, CBDCs, and other Cardano blockchain products will have a home to showcase and trade their products.

solution: 私たちは、個人や機関投資家のお客様に、ブロックチェーンを活用したクロスボーダー決済ソリューションを提供します。
experience: 暗号通貨とFXの取引所を開発してテストしました。
